ratings.comment: Erik is a super nice professor. He has the stereotypical "old man" presence in a cute way. The class itself is fairly interesting and the lectures highlight the important information from the book. All test answers come straight from the lecture slides! Beware the multiple choice graph/stat questions as those are most difficult.

I love this professor. He is so knowledgeable about sociology and really opened my mind up. It is a super chill course and the material is something you want to learn. He is very respectful of other people's views and encourages debating/ challenging his views. If you have opportunity to take this class dont' hesitate it is awesome!
He's an awesome lecturer and he really cares about what he is speaking about! He's super nice and cute in an old-guy kind of way! I would definitely suggest the class! easy A for sure!

Erik wrote the text book the class uses. There is a lot of overlap between lectures and the textbook; you really don't have to go to lecture. Your entire grade is pretty much based off of three exams, which are fairly straight-forward. I would highly recommend taking this class for an easy B. If you put a decent amount of work in you will get an A.

The class itself isn't too hard. Lectures posted online so you don't have to go to class. Majority essay questions on tests, with the addition of 5-10 multiple choice that are based on memorizing tons of exact statistics, for sure the hardest part. Lectures are dry. More like an economics class than a sociology class. Extreme politically bias!!

His lectures are clear and he takes the time to explain everything well. However, he is extremely one-sided in his political viewpoints, and makes them a part of the class. Tests required students to describe very specific terms, and students would be lose points if they did not almost exactly write the definition from the book.

He is really into himself and what he does.  He is very passionate about Sociology and teaching.  He's a nice guy but extremely one sided, and he knows it.  The class was really hard for me and I took notes, read the book for the most part and payed attention in class.  For the tests you need to go into a lot of detail for full credit. No big curve
Easy Class, Study from online slides (test questions come directly from them). Don't bother buying book. If you hate Capitalism and love Marxism you will have the best time in the world.

Professor Wright was SO helpful!! Go to office hours whenever you can, he loves what he's doing and loves it when students are equally engaged. Go to lecture and do the readings. He offers films too and those are easy and give you LOTS of points. Easy class and you'll learn so much.
if you're interested in soc at all, don't take this class. more like econ. so boring but easy. none of the TA's speak english well

At first, the class seems fairly easy, but all the reading, lectures, and films are dry, biased material. Grading is extremely tough. If some concept isn't phased perfectly the whole answer is wrong. This added up a lot and made it super hard for me to get anything above a B. I'd take another sociology class if I could choose again. Not a fan.

Lectures are extremely boring, even though the materials are somewhat interesting. Mandatory documentaries and following film journals every week are definitely downers. Grading is very tough (You have to be very meticulous. FYI, I have a 3.5 GPA without counting this class and am barely passing this class). I don't recommend this class.

taking this class was the worst decision i could have made. the information including his entire book is biased. you are tested on the smallest details that you wouldn't think to study and the grading is ridiculous. i was actually interested in sociology but would rather stab my eyes out with a rusty spoon than listen to this guy.

While I would agree that the course is not especially difficult, I would never recommend going to lecture and, overall, it's a bore. Studying for exams is memorization of biased theories and word for word definitions. NOT my idea of a fascinating sociology course. If you have a kinky thing for Geppetto, though, by all means enroll.

My "epitome" of a college professor.  A little quirky, clearly loves his job -- and does what I find to be a good job doing it too! Lecture and book are practically identical, and podcasts are provided too. Its very easy to do well in this class with just a little bit of effort.

This is the most boring class. He wrote the book, which is mildly interesting, but his lectures are basically him saying everything that's in the book. And then in discussion they say everything that is in the book AGAIN. Don't go to lecture. Also, none of the TAs speak English.
If you are at UW-Madison, have any interest, however mild, in social theory or politics, and you DO NOT take a class from this man, I feel very sorry for you.

what a crazy cat. he can get a little boring at times, but he is a great guy and loves what he is doing. the readings arent very necessary. he podcasted almost all the lectures, so it's easy not to go all the time. but he's a funny guy, so go to a few for sure
Boring lectures..don't go. Don't bother reading the reader either.  He posts the notes and if you memorize them you WILL get an A. Easy Class

When I took this class 3 years ago as a freshmen, he told us straight up that he would be teaching it as an Intermediate course which is bs. Also, had a mandatory 2 hour movie every week so it should have been 5 credits not 4. BAD BAD BAD.

Overall, Soc125 with Wright was easy. The readings were not a necessity. Either study or do the readings; doing both was overkill. Lectures tend to drag on a bit, but in general the class is interesting and relevant. I'd recommend it as a good way to fulfill a humanities credit.

don't even buy the course packet, i read every single word in it and spent so many hours reading it, but you don't need to know anything from the readings! and now with the podcasts you don't even need to attend. i hated my TA, but there was an easy TA one of my friends had which basically gave his students the test q's, so that helped a lot!
Pretty boring lectures....nice guy....VERY comprehensive tests. If you study a little, easy A.

wright is awesome, im very conservative so youd think id hate him, but you just gotta appreciate how liberal he is and love how funny he is. the class has great exams because if you study you get rewarded for it. TAs are very helpful and so are podcast lectures. take this class!

very easy... lectures not madatory after he started podcasts this in the fall of 2006... just listen to them once before the exam and you can get an A... very easy exams because all you got to know is the broad stuff (no details)... i never did readings and got an A because he says important reading stuff in lectures... easy A ever!!!!

This is a very easy class. You really don't need to do the readings, just pay attention to the lectures and you get an easy A. He explains things very clearly, even though the material is sometimes boring or just common sense. He posts pod-casts of all the lectures online, and slides online so you can do fine without going to lectures

even though some of the things he discussed were on no interest to me, i could tell that he really cared about what he taught. the subject matter and notes were very easy to extract their meaning from. i think that he overall a good guy.

The two main things you need to know about Erik Wright and Soc. 125 are that unless he changes his mind next semester, the readings are useless...don't bother with them, in lecture he tends to make a solid point (on lecutre outline) and then ramble about tangents for a bit, if you get the main ideas feel free to space out. Test are easy!
Meh. He thinks he knows everything. Insanely liberal, but a good professor. Overall, he's pretty good.

simply put: worst class i've ever taken. second worst teacher i've ever had. Elementary class that he says he teaches as if it were an Intermediate class. Also REQUIRED movie session which is bull****.. didn't point that out before class started.
best class i ever took in undergrad and graduate school.  i changed my major because of his class.

Thought this would be an east intro soc. class.  I had Erik as my T.A.  Difficult grader on the paper, and boring discussion.  If you get a good T.A. you might luck out in this class.  B on first exam, B on paper, and must have failed the final to get a C in the class.  VERY VERY LIBERAL!

The class itself is really easy.Lectures are long and really boring, he reads directly from what he has typed out.Readings are really unnecessary b/c he explains the main points in lecture.  If you currently like anything about American society beware b/c he will refute all of in favor of communism.
Hard exams and uber boring lectures!
take this class
Enjoyed the class....must form your own opinions on subjects that are covered in class
No Comments

Genuinely loves the material. Opinionated and Very liberal- makes it clear and encourages debate.  Boring lectures. Reads prepared lecture verbatum.  Heavy boring and overly academic reading load but describes most important issues in lecture. Worth Only if lucky w/ TA. Great topic tho often painful
He is very opininated and open to others comments and opinions,too. Tests were a little hard.

Too orthodox to generate valuable discussion. Expects the students to learn his way, rather than letting them internalize knowledge or learning from them. He is smart, and knows a lot; but you can learn the same by reading his books. Lastly, if you are pro capitalism, forget taking his classes.
His lectures are more worthless than a poopy flavored lollipop.  I despised his class, I took American Society, not Micro-economics and Poli Sci.

this guy is an easy teacher, there are two exams and one paper and you don't really have to go to lecture, just know what drives communism and be prepared to be completely indoctrinated with complete radical communist thought, if youre a conservative it's fun to argue. overall boring but easy
hes passionate and hard-working. Take the class if only for the exceptional documentaries he shows

This professor is quite biased when it comes to reacting student questions and comments. If you are not a hard core marxist, your contribution will be undervalued. Female students find him a little bit ****, though I cannot say anything since I am a man.

1 required out-of-class movie screened per week.Lecture can be boring-many civics-related topics(democracy, taxes, capitalism, elections, etc).Some think he's biased. Steer clear if you're an easily enraged conservative.Lots of reading. Grade= midterm, final, 1 paper. He's brilliant though.
THIS CLASS IS RIDICULOUSLY DIFFICULT
